specificLearningOutcomes: identity their uniqueness as guided by the word of God
state their gender according to Genesis 1:27
appreciate that God knows them by their names
suggestedLearningExperiences: in pairs read Genesis 1:27
say why they are a special creation
sing songs related to their uniqueness
state their gender as guided by Genesis 1:27
draw and colour a picture of a boy and a girl
in turns read Isaiah 43:1
write their names on flashcards and display them in class
sing songs related to their names
watch a clip of a palm of a hand with a name on it
draw the palm of a hand and write their names
Sing the song, ‘I’ am fearfully and wonderfully made’
memorise Isaiah 49:16
keyInquiryQuestions: What makes you a special creation?

specificLearningOutcomes: name members of their family
pray with family members to foster unity
identify five items they share at home
appreciate family members by praying with them
suggestedLearningExperiences: list names of family members on flashcards
draw and colour family members
demonstrate how they pray at home
list the number of times they pray at home as a family
mention instances they lead prayers at home
in groups or pairs, list items they share at home
colour a picture of a family sharing a meal
sing the song, ’Read your Bible pray every day’
memorise Matthew 7:7
keyInquiryQuestions: How do you relate with members of your family?

specificLearningOutcomes: name plants and animals in the environment
take part in keeping the home environment clean
appreciate God’s creation by caring for plants and animals
suggestedLearningExperiences: picture-read Genesis 1:11, 24
name various plants and animals created by God and write them on flashcards
take a nature walk and identify different plants and animals in their environment
draw and colour some plants and animals in the school environment
say how they participate in keeping the home environment clean
model some animals and display their work in class
keyInquiryQuestions: Why should you take care of plants and animals?

specificLearningOutcomes: identify five ways of handling the Holy Bible
mention the two divisions of the Holy Bible
name the first two books in the New Testament
desire to handle the Holy Bible with respect
suggestedLearningExperiences: say how they take care of the Holy Bible
tell why they should respect the Holy Bible
role-play handling the Holy Bible with care and respect
in small groups mention the two divisions of the Holy Bible (Old and New Testament)
name the first two Gospel books (Matthew and Mark)
listen to and sing a song about the Bible
sing a song on ‘read your Bible pray every day’
keyInquiryQuestions: Why should you handle the Holy Bible with respect?

subStrands.subStrandTitle: Bible Story: Joseph and his brothers
specificLearningOutcomes: narrate the story of Joseph and his brothers
discuss ways they treat their siblings
identify three values needed for peaceful co-existence
desire to live harmoniously with family members
suggestedLearningExperiences: watch a video on Joseph’s coat of many colours in Genesis 37:3-4
draw a coat and colour it
in turns, picture-read Joseph’s dream in Genesis 37:5-8,in groups, picture-read Genesis 37:9-11
role-play the story of Joseph
say why Joseph’s brothers hated him
in groups, share experiences of how they should treat their brothers and sisters
list values needed to live well with others
sing a song about Joseph and his coat of many colours
keyInquiryQuestions: How did Joseph relate with his brothers?

subStrands.subStrandTitle: Bible Story: The chariot of fire
specificLearningOutcomes: retell the story of Elijah and the chariot of fire
list three ways of having a good relationship with God
desire to respect God and their parents
suggestedLearningExperiences: picture-read 2 Kings 2:1,11-12
in groups draw and colour the chariot of fire
watch a video clip of Elijah and the Chariot of fire
in pairs, tell their friend three ways of pleasing God
sing a song about Elijah and the Chariot of Fire
write 2 Kings 2:12 on flashcards and display it in the Christian Religious Education learning corner
in groups, tell ways they respect their parents or guardians at home

strands.strandTitle: The Early Life of Jesus Christ

specificLearningOutcomes: retell the birth of Jesus Christ
dramatise the birth of Jesus Christ
express the joy of the angels through song and dance
appreciate the birth of Jesus by participating in Christmas celebrations
suggestedLearningExperiences: picture-read the birth of Jesus according to Luke 2:4-13 and retell the story
role-play the birth of Jesus Christ
listen and dance to a recorded Christmas carol ‘We wish you a Merry Christmas’
sing a song related to Luke 2:13-14
observe pictures of Jesus Christ’s parents and name each of them as they point at the pictures
observe pictures or watch a video clip of angels worshipping Baby Jesus
sing and dance to the song of the angels (Luke 2:13-14)
keyInquiryQuestions: Why do we celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ?

specificLearningOutcomes: retell the story of Jesus Christ in the Temple
obey their parents as portrayed by Jesus Christ
take part in Sunday or Sabbath school activities
desire to accompany their parents to church as portrayed by Jesus Christ
suggestedLearningExperiences: draw and colour the church
in turns picture read Luke 2: 42-49
observe pictures of Jesus Christ in the temple
sequentially arrange flashcards on the events that took place when Jesus was left in the temple
tell how Jesus Christ obeyed His parents
share experiences of how they obey their parents at home
list activities they engage in at Sunday or Sabbath School
keyInquiryQuestions: Why did Jesus Christ visit the temple?

specificLearningOutcomes: name the place where Jesus Christ was baptised
identify the person who baptised Jesus Christ
practise humility in their interaction with others
suggestedLearningExperiences: mention occasions, they witnessed people being baptised in their churches
in turns, picture-read Matthew 3:13-15
watch a video clip on the Baptism of Jesus Christ
mention the place where Jesus was baptised
name the person who baptised Jesus Christ
in groups draw and colour Jesus being baptised
tell how Jesus showed humility during His baptism
sing baptismal songs familiar to them
keyInquiryQuestions: Why is the baptism of Jesus Christ important to Christians today?

specificLearningOutcomes: retell how Jesus changed water into wine
obey instructions as portrayed in the wedding at Cana
desire to be obedient in their interaction with others
suggestedLearningExperiences: in groups, tell a story of a wedding that they attended and what they liked most
picture-read the story of changing water into wine; John 2:1-10
watch a video clip on the miracle of changing water into wine
tell how the servants responded to Jesus’ instructions in John 2:7-9
sing a song related to this miracle
share experiences of how they depend on God to provide for their needs
in groups, role-play how they obey their parents and teachers
draw and colour the six jars of water
keyInquiryQuestions: What happened at Cana of Galilee?

specificLearningOutcomes: retell the healing of Simon’s mother-in-law
show gratitude to others as portrayed by Simon’s mother- in- law
appreciate Jesus’s power to heal the sick
suggestedLearningExperiences: share experiences of how they help learners in need
role-play an instance where they helped a learner in need
picture-read the miracle according to Luke 4:38- 39
arrange pictures based on the miracle sequentially
retell the miracle after watching a video clip
role-play the healing of Simon’s mother-in-law
write a thank you note to parents and others who help them in their daily lives
sing thanksgiving songs to express gratitude to God
keyInquiryQuestions: How did Simon’s mother-in-law express gratitude?

specificLearningOutcomes: identify items they share at home as a family
practise the value of sharing at home and school
retell the story of the little boy with two fish and five loaves
desire to keep the environment clean and avoid wastage
suggestedLearningExperiences: identify items that can be shared at home
in pairs mention items shared at home and school
watch or listen to the miracle in John 6:1-14
role-play the story of the little boy with two fish and five loaves
draw and colour the two fish and five loaves
sing a song on sharing
keep the environment clean (John 6:12-13)
keyInquiryQuestions: Why is it important to share with others?

specificLearningOutcomes: list the importance of obeying parents
practise obedience at home as guided by the scriptures
exercise obedience in day-to-day life
suggestedLearningExperiences: in pairs read Ephesians 6:1-3
in groups mention why they should obey their parents
say the benefits of obeying parents
in pairs tell how they obey their parents at home
listen to and sing a song on obedience
memorise Ephesians 6:2-3
keyInquiryQuestions: Why should you obey your parents?

specificLearningOutcomes: state reasons for telling the truth
demonstrate honesty by not stealing other people’s items
practise punctuality at school and home
desire to be truthful in their daily lives
suggestedLearningExperiences: game read Ephesians 4:25
in groups say why they should always speak the truth
say why they should not steal or pick items that do not belong to them
role-play situations of honesty while dealing with other people’s items
sing a song on truthfulness
story tell instances they took lost and found items to the teacher
mention reasons for getting home and school on time (punctuality)
keyInquiryQuestions: Why is it bad to lie?

specificLearningOutcomes: mention three ways of expressing gratitude to their parents or guardians
practise thankfulness at home as guided by the Bible
desire to be thankful in daily life
suggestedLearningExperiences: say why they should thank their parents
in pairs share when to thank parents
role-play how to thank parents
compose and recite a poem on thanking their parents
sing a song about praising God for the gift of parents or guardians
write 1Thessalonians 5:18 on flashcards and recite it
write flashcards on why they should be thankful to their parents or guardians and display the cards in class
keyInquiryQuestions: Why should you thank your parents or guardians?

specificLearningOutcomes: recognise the Church as a place of worship and respect it
demonstrate responsibility by serving God in Church
desire to grow in faith by attending Sunday or Sabbath School
suggestedLearningExperiences: in pairs mention ways they respect the church as a place of worship
list the benefits of going to church
list the number of times they go to church
role-play activities they do in church (e.g. praying, reading the Bible, singing, dancing)
sing and dance to the song in Psalms 100:4 (I will enter His gates with thanksgiving…)
keyInquiryQuestions: Why do you go to Church?
Why should you respect the Church?

specificLearningOutcomes: recite simple thanksgiving prayers
practise saying simple prayers at different times of the day
desire to pray always as taught by Jesus Christ
suggestedLearningExperiences: picture-read Mathew 21:13
in groups compose and recite simple prayers
pray for family members
list the number of times they pray at home or in Sunday or /Sabbath School
say simple prayers before and after taking meals and before they leave for home
keyInquiryQuestions: Why is it important to pray always?
